formattedAddress: 389 West St, New York, NY 10014, USA
adrFormatAddress: 389 West St, New York, NY 10014, USA

editorialSummary.text: Open-air waterfront locale serving oysters, seafood dishes & burgers, plus cocktails, wines & beers.

originalText.text: We were there on the last day before the warm weather was over. Really nice sitting outside and enjoy the cold beer in super cold glass. Can’t go wrong with that.

text.text: We were there on the last day before the warm weather was over. Really nice sitting outside and enjoy the cold beer in super cold glass. Can’t go wrong with that.

originalText.text: Got there around 5:45 on a sunny Thursday evening. Ambiance is beautiful with the river and sunset right next to you. However the food and amount of time it took to get my drink was disappointing. Ordered french fries, oysters, and a glass of wine when I sat down. Fries came out in 10 minutes, another 3 minutes came the oysters. 2 minutes later my wine arrived. The oysters were okay. I chose the east coast and they were just okay something about them just didn’t seem too fresh. Once my wine arrived, I put in an order for a chicken sandwich. By this time the place was much more crowded and I could tell people sitting beside me were getting agitated about how long it was taking for their drinks to arrive. My sandwich was prompt and arrived less than 10 minutes from when I put in my order. Unfortunately I was disappointed, it just had an overwhelming taste of “fried”. Not much flavor at all even though there was some kind of spicy mayo on it. Seems the chicken or breading itself was not seasoned at all. The best part of my meal was the french fries and wine (which can be had anywhere). For a small meal that came out to $70 for one person, I was extremely underwhelmed. Unfortunately I won’t be retuning.

originalText.text: Waterfront restaurant from the Grand Banks team but closer to Christopher and the west side highway. All the food was quite solid that we had from both the brunch and regular menu. Great for people watching. Caviar trout roe and hash browns were my fav.

text.text: Waterfront restaurant from the Grand Banks team but closer to Christopher and the west side highway. All the food was quite solid that we had from both the brunch and regular menu. Great for people watching. Caviar trout roe and hash browns were my fav.

originalText.text: Gorgeous waterfront spot along the Hudson to indulge in amazing oysters, beautifully crafted cocktails, and some quality local craft beers. I had the Kusshi oysters from British Columbia and they were as luscious and succulent as butter! And the local Sunday lager on tap was a superb refresher to a hot summer's day in the sun. Thanks to the whole team!

text.text: Gorgeous waterfront spot along the Hudson to indulge in amazing oysters, beautifully crafted cocktails, and some quality local craft beers. I had the Kusshi oysters from British Columbia and they were as luscious and succulent as butter! And the local Sunday lager on tap was a superb refresher to a hot summer's day in the sun. Thanks to the whole team!

originalText.text: Perfect place to meet a friend or date on the waterfront or just go with your dog like me. Food was great even for a vegetarian like me. My appreciation to the staff who found a way to accommodate me even when it was busy. Thank for a great day.

text.text: Perfect place to meet a friend or date on the waterfront or just go with your dog like me. Food was great even for a vegetarian like me. My appreciation to the staff who found a way to accommodate me even when it was busy. Thank for a great day.
